      • getStatus

        public DirectoryStatus getStatus()
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Returns the directory's status.

        An enabled directory may be used by applications to login accounts found within the directory. A disabled directory prevents its accounts from being used to login to applications.

        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface Directory
        Returns:
        the directory's status.

      • createAccount

        public void createAccount(Account account)
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Creates a new account instance in the directory using the Directory's default registration workflow setting. Whether a registration workflow is triggered or not for the account is based on the Directory's default setting.

        Note: In the Stormpath REST API, new resources are created by interacting with a collection resource. Therefore, this method is a convenience: it automatically issues a create with the directory's account collection.

        Specified by:
        createAccount in interface Directory
        Parameters:
        account - the account instance to create in the directory.
        See Also:
        Directory.createAccount(com.stormpath.sdk.account.Account, boolean)

      • createAccount

        public void createAccount(Account account,
                 boolean registrationWorkflowEnabled)
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Creates a new account instance in the directory with an explicit registration workflow directive.

        If registrationWorkflowEnabled is true, the account registration workflow will be triggered no matter what the Directory configuration is.

        If registrationWorkflowEnabled is false, the account registration workflow will NOT be triggered, no matter what the Directory configuration is.

        If you want to ensure the registration workflow behavior matches the Directory default, call the Directory.createAccount(com.stormpath.sdk.account.Account) method instead.

        Note: In the Stormpath REST API, new resources are created by interacting with a collection resource. Therefore, this method is a convenience: it automatically issues a create with the directory's account collection using the specified registrationWorkflowEnabled argument.

        Specified by:
        createAccount in interface Directory
        Parameters:
        account - account the account instance to create in the directory.
        registrationWorkflowEnabled - whether or not the account registration workflow will be triggered, no matter what the Directory configuration is.

      • createAccount

        public void createAccount(CreateAccountRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Creates a new account instance in the directory with options to override the registration workflow directive and retrieve account's references in the creation response.

        Example

         directory.createAccount(Accounts.newCreateRequestFor(account).build());

        If you would like to force disabling the backing directory's account registration workflow: 

         directory.createAccount(Accounts.newCreateRequestFor(account).setRegistrationWorkflowEnabled(false).build());
        If you would like to force the execution of the registration workflow, no matter what the backing directory configuration is: 
         directory.createAccount(Accounts.newCreateRequestFor(account).setRegistrationWorkflowEnabled(true).build());
        If you would like to retrieve the account's custom data in the response of the account creation. 
         directory.createAccount(Accounts.newCreateRequestFor(account).withResponseOptions(Accounts.options().withCustomData()).build());

        Note: In the Stormpath REST API, new resources are created by interacting with a collection resource. Therefore, this method is a convenience: it automatically issues a create with the directory's account collection using the specified registrationWorkflowEnabled argument.

        Specified by:
        createAccount in interface Directory

      • getAccounts

        public AccountList getAccounts()
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Returns a paginated list of all accounts in the Directory.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all accounts, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more accounts using the Directory.getAccounts(java.util.Map) method instead of this one.

        Specified by:
        getAccounts in interface Directory
        Returns:
        a paginated list of all accounts in the Directory.
        See Also:
        Directory.getAccounts(java.util.Map)

      • getAccounts

        public AccountList getAccounts(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Returns a paginated list of the directory's accounts that match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../directories/directoryId/accounts?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...
        Specified by:
        getAccounts in interface Directory
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the directory's accounts that match the specified query criteria.

      • getAccounts

        public AccountList getAccounts(AccountCriteria criteria)
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Returns a paginated list of the directory's accounts that match the specified query criteria. The Accounts utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL - most modern IDEs can auto-suggest and auto-complete as you type, allowing for an easy query-building experience. For example: 
         directory.getAccounts(Accounts.where(
     Accounts.username().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Accounts.surname().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderBySurname().descending()
     .orderByGivenName().ascending()
     .withGroups(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        or, if you use static imports: 
         import static com.stormpath.sdk.account.Accounts.*;

 ...

 directory.getAccounts(where(
     username().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(surname().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderBySurname().descending()
     .orderByGivenName().ascending()
     .withGroups(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Specified by:
        getAccounts in interface Directory
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the directory's accounts that match the specified query criteria.

      • getGroups

        public GroupList getGroups(GroupCriteria criteria)
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Returns a paginated list of the directory's groups that match the specified query criteria. The Groups utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL - most modern IDEs can auto-suggest and auto-complete as you type, allowing for an easy query-building experience. For example: 
         directory.getGroups(Groups.where(
     Groups.name().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Groups.description().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName()
     .orderByDescription().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        or, if you use static imports: 
         import static com.stormpath.sdk.account.Accounts.*;

 ...

 directory.getGroups(where(
     name().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(description().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName()
     .orderByDescription().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Specified by:
        getGroups in interface Directory
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's groups that match the specified query criteria.

      • createGroup

        public void createGroup(CreateGroupRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: Directory
        Creates a new group instance in the directory, with the option to retrieve groups references in the group creation response.

        Example

         directory.createGroup(Groups.newCreateRequestFor(group).build());

        If you would like to retrieve the group's custom data in the response of the groups creation. 

         directory.createGroup(Groups.newCreateRequestFor(group).withResponseOptions(Groups.options().withCustomData()).build());

        Note: In the Stormpath REST API, new resources are created by interacting with a collection resource. Therefore, this method is a convenience: it automatically issues a create with the directory's group collection.

        Specified by:
        createGroup in interface Directory
        Parameters:
        request - the group creation request
